did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The Fox Theater Memories Project Records (1883-2011) contains historical research files, oral history interviews, and documented restoration efforts of the Fox Theater gathered by the Fox Theater Memories Project.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Fox Theater Memories Project Records (MS 560). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Fox Tucson Theater began its life as a 1,300-seat movie palace on April 11th, 1930. For years it delighted Tucsonans with the finest Hollywood fare, including premieres and visits from stars. Also of note was the Mickey Mouse Club, an organized outlet for Tucson's kids to spend time at the theater to watch films, participate in contests, as well as other activities. The theater closed in 1974, remaining largely intact; the business records of the theater were thrown out. During the theater's closure, many homeless people found refuge inside the abandoned building.

In 1999, Tucson citizens formed the Fox Tucson Theatre Foundation, led by Herb Stratford who would later manage the theater's operation from 2006 to 2008. As a non-profit corporation, the foundation's mission was to purchase, renovate, and restore the theater to its original grandeur. It is the only Southwest art deco theater known to exist, and in April 2004 was designated a National Landmark. The theater reopened in 2005 as a fully functioning movie palace and performing arts facility.

The Fox Theater Memories Project was part of the foundation's efforts, managed by Bill Buehler, to preserve Tucson's cultural heritage, having done extensive research on the history of the theater while the restoration was taking place. This project utilized several volunteers to help research materials, and many interviews with those that experienced the Fox Theater in its heyday were conducted.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 4 series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Records 1883-2011: This collection documents the Fox Theater as it was through press clipping copies, research project files, logs, oral history interviews as well as documented restoration efforts, all collected by volunteers of the Fox Theater Memories Project. Most materials are on copied or printed paper, but there are also newspaper clippings, photographs, written notes, VHS tapes, cassette tapes, and Mini DV tapes. Original business records for the theater are unavailable, as they were disposed of in the 1960s.

Contains historical research files collected and maintained by various volunteers. Files include press clipping copies from microfilm of news, events, and films pertaining to the Fox Theater in chronological order. Included is a complete history of all the films shown at the Fox Theater. Many files include notes written on the back of them. Some files serve as the basis of or are referenced to by many oral history interviews that were conducted.

did.unittitle: Alphabetized List of Movies at Fox,
Alphabetized List of Movies at Fox,

scopecontent.p: Contains subject files collected and maintained by various volunteers arranged alphabetically. Files cover many individual research projects conducted by Bill Buehler and the Memories Project. Many projects did not get completed while others were never researched. A majority of this series covers well-known personalities of the time that performed at, or were associated with, the Fox Theater. Other, more topical and miscellaneous files are also included.

did.unittitle: Film in Arizona, Arizona Film Commission,
Fox Ad, Tucson Gun Club Brochure,
Fox Personalities, Apache Dance Team AKA "Dooley's Indians",
Fox Personalities, Doctor William James Mayo,
Fox Personalities, Harry Encimas and the San Xavier Band,
Fox Personalities, Major Bowes Amateur Hour,
Fox Personalities, Rodeo -- Montana, Knight, and Holcomb,
The Marquee, Fox Tucson Theatre Foundation,

scopecontent.p: Contains files associated with the oral history interviews that were conducted by the Memories Project. Many photos and other ephemera were donated by interview subjects. Logs include specifications such as tape number, interest and release forms, abstracts of memories shared, as well as scheduling. Details such as the strategies employed while interviewing subjects, and planning of the project itself, which are administrative in nature, are included as well.

Contains oral history video interviews conducted by the Memories Project. Restoration work and efforts at the Fox Theater are also documented. Recorded materials are in VHS, tape cassette, and Mini DV formats and comprise about 70 hours and approximately 100 interviews. These materials are arranged by tape number and type.
